doc.previous: Each island has its own high chief or ulu aliki and several sub chiefs alikis The community council is the Falekaupule the traditional assembly of elders or te sina o fenua literally grey hairs of the land In the past another caste the priests tofuga were also amongst the decision makers The ulu aliki and aliki exercise informal authority at the local level Ulu aliki are always chosen based on ancestry Under the Falekaupule Act 1997 95 the powers and functions of the Falekaupule are now shared with the pule o kaupule elected village presidents one on each atoll 96
doc.after: Local government districts consisting of more than one islet
